text:
In the ant <java> task, I need to specify the equivalent of
the command line arguments
  -Dhttp.proxyHost=webcache.sfbay.sun.com          \
  -Dhttp.proxyPort=8080                            \

I've tried 
   <jvmarg value="-Dhttp.proxyHost=webcache.sfbay.sun.com,
                  -Dhttp.proxyPort=8080" />
and
   <jvmarg value="Dhttp.proxyHost=webcache.sfbay.sun.com,
                  Dhttp.proxyPort=8080" />

Neither seems to work, and the manual is quiet on the subject.
creator: eric.armstrong@sun.com
eric.armstrong@sun.com
text:
The right way to do it turned out to be:
   line="-Dhttp.proxyHost=<myProxy>
         -Dhttp.proxyPort=8080"

But somehow, this simple formulation eluded me.

A jvmarg example of some kind in the "command line"
section would have helped.

creator: stevel@apache.org
text: um, what was wrong with a separate <sysproperty> decl for each property?

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
The manual for the value attributes says:

> a single command-line argument; can contain space characters.

while you are trying to pass multiple arguments.
